turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: You took that money from Julia's hand.

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: I didn't.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Then what are you hiding?

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: It's a piece of evidence that's worth a great deal more than that.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: You hand that over to the police.

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: I'll do nothing of the sort.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: All right, then.  I'll tell them.

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: I don't think you will.  It's your father's.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: I don't believe it! You're lying!

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: There!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh!

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: Now do you believe me!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Mother!

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: And I'll give then proof!

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: How are you?  Here.  Get under this.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Thanks...  we're taking your cab.

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: Is your father still in there?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: He's waiting for you.

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: Did he tell you where he was going?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: He wouldn't say.

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: Tch-tch-tch --  Well, goodbye, Miss Wynant.  You wouldn't drive slowly, so you don't get a tip.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: He didn't do it -- Nick!

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Another Martini --

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Hello, there!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: You know, we know each other.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Of course we do! We've been friends for years.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Aren't you Nick Charles?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: You don't remember me.....  I'm Dorothy Wynant.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Not that scrawny little....?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: How did you ever remember me?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: was fascinated with you....  a real live detective....  You used to tell me the most wonderful stories.  Were they true?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Probably not.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Andy...  this is Nick Charles.  He worked on a case for father.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Yes.  Some nut who wanted to kill him.  How is your father?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: That's what I was going to ask you.  he's disappeared!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Disappeared!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I don't know anything -- I've been in California for four years. What about his lawyer? Used to be a guy named Mac-- something.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Macaulay.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: That's it...  Herbert Macaulay.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: tried him once -

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Why don't you try him again?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Your father?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: No.  The lawyer -- I'm going to see him.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: How do you do?  I'm sorry we have to rush.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: We're at the Normandie for a couple of weeks.  Why don't you drop around?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Thanks.  We will.  Goodbye.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I just wanted to relieve your mind. Your father's alive and all right.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh, thank heaven.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Come on in.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: I've got to see you alone!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: You heard about Julia Wolf?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: There.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: What are you trying to tell me? That you did it?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Yes.  I hated her for coming between my mother and father.  She kept me from seeing my father.  I went down there to ask her where he was.  She wouldn't tell me, and I shot her.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Where did you hit her?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Why... in the heart.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Pretty good shot you are. What did she do?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: She fell down.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Did she make any sound?  Didn't scream?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Which way did she fall?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: She... she fell over backwards.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Oh, yeah?  People fall toward a shot, you know...  not back from it.  I knew you were lying.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Where did you get this gun?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: I bought it in a pawn shop.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Don't lie to me.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: That's the truth.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Hello, Dorothy.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Hello, Nick!  And a party - celebrating father's third murder -

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Dead?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: He's been dead for three months.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: It's been the same one for three months.

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: Forgive me.  How are you?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Take a good look at him, Dad.  Now please try to remember him... 'cause he's going to be your son- in-law.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: He'll still be your son-in-law!

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: You see how much we have to say.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Dad, this is what I really wanted to ask you....

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Mother's set her heart on a big church wedding.

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: Yes, she would.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: I hate all that fuss.  But I'll do it on one condition -- that you're there to give me away.

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: What would your mother say to that?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: This is my wedding.

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: Wouldn't it be a little embarrassing ...  all of us there ...  your other and me and your stepfather?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: He can stay home.  Please, Dad, won't you?

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: If you think it'll be all right.

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: Wait a minute.  When is it going to be? I'm leaving town tonight.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: It's a secret.  I can't even tell you, my dear.  I've got an important idea to work on.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: A new invention?

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: Yes.  And I don't want anybody to steal it from me.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: We were planning to be married right after Christmas.

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: Oh, I'll be back before Christmas.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: It's a promise?

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: That's one thing I won't forget.  Where's Macaulay?  I ought to be starting.

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: How's your brother?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: He's all right.

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: I'd like to see him.  Why don't you bring him down?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: You know how it is, Dad.  He's sort of under Mother's thumb.

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: I know -- I know --

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: You're not missing much.  He's cuckoo.

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: Like all the rest of us.  Has this fellow...  ...has he seen the whole family?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: And he still wants to marry me!

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: He's a brave man.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Poor Dad, does that still bother you?

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: Only in bad weather.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: But it isn't bad weather now.

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: Better get home before it is.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Goodbye, darling.  Don't you dare forget...  December 30th.

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: Goodbye, my boy.  Take care of Dorothy.  Show her that there is such a thing as a happy marriage.

turns.speaker: DR. WALTON
turns.text: You can take that out to the car.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Going to run him through the fluoroscope?

turns.speaker: DR. WALTON
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Do you mind if I come down and see it?

turns.speaker: DR. WALTON
turns.text: Not at all.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I'm very interested in that body.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Shrapnel!

turns.speaker: DR. WALTON
turns.text: Must have been in the war.  That might account for the cane and his limp.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Yes... yes.

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: What is it, Gilbert? Tell mother! What did he say?

turns.speaker: GILBERT
turns.text: He said that father's in town. He's been seeing Julia right along.

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: That woman!

turns.speaker: GILBERT
turns.text: She could tell you where father is.

turns.speaker: GILBERT
turns.text: Did they find any clues...  a gun or fingerprints or anything?

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: Not a thing.

turns.speaker: GILBERT
turns.text: Was there much blood?

turns.speaker: GILBERT
turns.text: Did you kill her?

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: Gilbert!

turns.speaker: GILBERT
turns.text: Why not? You had a perfectly good motive.

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: I hope you won't talk that way to the police when they come here.

turns.speaker: GILBERT
turns.text: Well, I've got my alibi.  I was at the Public Library.  Where were you?

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: Children, will you go into the next room? I want to talk to Chris alone.

turns.speaker: GILBERT
turns.text: I saw him too... he was wearing a green suit with a white tie...

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: What are you talking about, Gilbert? You weren't there!

turns.speaker: GILBERT
turns.text: know.  But I saw him -

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: How'd you people happen to pop in?

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: We hear this is getting to be sort of a meeting place for the Wynant family, so we figure we'll stick around in case the old man himself shows up.  Then we seen him...  ...sneak in and we decide to come up.  And pretty lucky for you.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Yes.  I might not have been shot.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: We were looking for this bird.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I never saw him before.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: What's he want of you?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Wanted to tell me he didn't kill Julia Wolf.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: What's that to you?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: What'd he think it was to you?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Ask him.  I don't know.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: I'm asking you.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Keep on asking.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Not without a warrant.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: So you say -  Go on, Bob.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: Have you got a pistol permit?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: Ever heard of the Sullivan Act?

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: This gun yours?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: Who's is it?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I'll have to try to remember.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: Okay.  There's plenty of time. I guess we got to ask you a lot more questions than we counted on. We'll come up tomorrow when you're feeling better.  Come on.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: You oughtn't to play this trick on me.  Running out when I was giving you time to rest up before I asked you those questions.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: You mean about that gun?

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: That ain't a gun any more.  The firing pin's busted - the -  Don't waste time talking about that.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: Man to man, Mr. Charles, are you working on this case?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Man to man, I'm not.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: So would I.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: It's a bargain then.  Anything you want to know?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: What about the suicide?

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: Oh, that's a phoney.  The men didn't even have to go down.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I thought it might be.  From now on, they're going to think that every thin man over six feet with white hair is Wynant.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: You've been there?

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: Yeah. Couldn't find a thing. This is the way we figure it.  Wynant goes to Julia's apartment. He finds Morelli there... sees she's two- timing him.  They have a fight. But he figures he don't want to do anything then.... Morelli might squeal.  So he goes away. He don't let his lawyer know anything has happened... he lets him go ahead and and hand over money to Julia to give to him, so that Julia will think it's all blown over. Then, when she don't expect it... he lets her have it.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: No proof?

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: Nothing yet to cinch it.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Fifty will get you a hundred that he didn't do it.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: For one thing, he was too absent- minded to hold a grudge.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: Who's your candidate?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I haven't got that far yet.  But I don't think that everything points to Wynant.  What about the alibis?

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: They're all O.K.  Mrs. Jorgensen, the boy, Dorothy, Macaulay... even Morelli... we had to let him go.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: What about Jorgensen?

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: I'll check on that.  I'm afraid this is kinder dull for you.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: What about this Nunheim?

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: Oh, he's all right.  We know all about him.  He does a little stooling for us every once in a while.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Did you know he was hanging around Julia?

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: He's holding out on you.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: Let's go and see.  Taxi!

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: Well, what'd you think?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I think we're on the right track.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: Who're you calling?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I'm calling your office so you can send out a man to trail him. I want to see where he goes.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: Trail him!  Trail who?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Nunheim!

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: Get anything?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: She's ready to talk.  It won't do any harm, though - to find out where he is.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: I guess that cinches it, eh, Mr. Charles?  He killed them both - Julia Wolf and Nunheim.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Fifty will still get you a hundred.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: This is enough for me.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Just rolled them up and threw them in.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: Lucky thing for us they weren't in that lime.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Extraordinarily lucky.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: "D.W.R."  That case you worked on... the guy who threatened to kill Wynant... what what was his name?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Rosebreen.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: Could this be him?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I never saw him.  I don't think anyone saw him.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: He said Wynant tried to steal an invention.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Yes.  But we figured it was just blackmail...

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: Just the same, Wynant wouldn't mind having him out of the way, would he?  How long should you say this body'd been here, Doc?

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: What're you doing here?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I'll take care of him.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: Are you kidding?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: Why didn't you tell me? .... Why didn't you hold him?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Because I found out for certain that he didn't commit the murders.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: You mean that body-----?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: --was Wynant's.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: Shut up.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: You see, he'd been very clever. Everybody, even our astute friend Guild, thought that Wynant was alive and that he was the murderer. But our hero had just one weak link in his chain.  The telegrams, wires and telephones were all very well - but no one had seen Wynant. So he picked on poor Mimi here to strengthen his case.  Mimi is the only one at the table who can tell us who the real murderer is.  Mimi, who was it that told you to say you'd seen Wynant?

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: When was the last time you gave her money for Wynant?

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: Yesterday.  I gave her a thousand dollars.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: Seen any signs of it, Bill?

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: I said he hadn't written me.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: Oh, then you did hear from him?

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: Well....

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: Well, what?

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: He telephoned me today.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: He did!

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: I wasn't in.  My secretary took the message.  He left word for me to meet him at the Plaza.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: When was that?

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: About three.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: Did you go?

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: Yes.  But he didn't show up.

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: I know he'll turn up as soon as he sees this in the papers.  You can't think he had anything to do with it, Mr. Guild.  He wasn't the kind of man that....

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: Do you know what they fought about that night he went away?

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: I didn't know they had a fight.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: Well, thanks.  We'll call you when we need you again.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: There are a few things we want to check up on.

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: I see.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: You say you were in the room with the body from the time you discovered it 'til we came?

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: Why yes.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: Did you see anything in Miss Wolfe's hand?

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: Are you sure you didn't leave the room...  that one of the bellhops or maids might not have been in there alone?

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: I don't think so.  Of course I was terribly upset...  I hardly knew what I was doing.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: The Medical Examiner seems to think that the body was touched.  He says it looks as if the girl's hand had been forced open after she was killed....

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: That's all right.  Well, we'll be going.

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: Goodbye.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: Goodbye.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: You did!

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: That's nothing.  I saw him myself.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: What kind of clothes was he wearing?

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: A brown suit, brown shoes and a white shirt and a grayish tie with red, or reddish brown figures on it.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: Tell 'em.

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: That's ridiculous.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: Let him have his say out.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: Good morning --

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Good morning, Lieutenant -  Sorry.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: But he's interested!

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: I don't mind telling you I'd rather have you working with us than against us.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Do you think that Wynant did it?

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: Looks like he planned, something. He shut up his apartment and his shop.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: I think we may as well sit down.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: I guess all the suspects are here.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Mr. Guild means guests!  Oh, there are two more to come.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: They'll be here.  Don't worry.  My men are picking them up.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: You're a great help to a hostess. I wish I always had you for my dinner parties.

turns.speaker: NUNHEIM
turns.text: Have a shot?

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: What's the idea of telling me you just knew the Wolfe girl by sight?

turns.speaker: NUNHEIM
turns.text: That's all I did, Lieutenant. That's the God's truth.  Maybe I said hello to her or how are you or something like that when I saw her, but that's all I knew her. That's the truth.  All right.  Put your mouth in and I'll pop a tooth out of it.

turns.speaker: NUNHEIM
turns.text: She drives me nuts.  She's been ragging me all day.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: Maybe if you quit running around after other women you wouldn't have so much trouble with this one.

turns.speaker: NUNHEIM
turns.text: That's a lie, Lieutenant...  Anybody that says that is a liar.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: Want to take a poke at him?

turns.speaker: NUNHEIM
turns.text: I didn't mean you, Mister.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: You'd done better to have told me that in the beginning.  Where were you the afternoon she was knocked off?

turns.speaker: NUNHEIM
turns.text: You don't think I had anything to do with it?

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: Where were you?

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: Where were you?

turns.speaker: NUNHEIM
turns.text: Marian!  Marian! Don't go! I'll behave!  I'll do anything!  Don't go, Marian!

turns.speaker: NUNHEIM
turns.text: Let me go!  Let me bring her back. I can't get along without her. I'll bring her right back and I'll tell you anything you want to know. Let me go!

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: Sit down!  We didn't come here to watch you and that broad dance around a May pole.  Where were you the afternoon the girl was killed?

turns.speaker: NUNHEIM
turns.text: I can't remember offhand, Lieutenant.  Maybe I was over at Charlie's shooting pool. Maybe I was here.  She'd remember.

turns.speaker: GUILD
turns.text: How'd you like to be thrown in the can on account of not remembering?

turns.speaker: NUNHEIM
turns.text: Just give me a minute....  I'll remember. I'm not stalling, Lieutenant.  You know I always come clean with you.  Gee, it'd serve me right if you had pinched me...  that's the afternoon I was.... wait, I'll show you...!

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: Don't mind what she says, Chris.

turns.speaker: JORGENSEN
turns.text: How can I help but mind? I'm constantly humiliated...  just because I haven't money.

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: I'll get some.

turns.speaker: JORGENSEN
turns.text: You've said that for weeks.

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: JORGENSEN
turns.text: Why don't you go to see Julia? She handles his money.

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: Chris!

turns.speaker: JORGENSEN
turns.text: All right.  All right.

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: I couldn't go near that woman.

turns.speaker: JORGENSEN
turns.text: I said all right!

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: What are you going to do?

turns.speaker: JORGENSEN
turns.text: Just what I said I'd do.

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: You wouldn't do that...  you wouldn't!

turns.speaker: JORGENSEN
turns.text: Wouldn't I.  Just watch me.

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: Chris -- Chris -- !

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: and there she was lying dead.  The police said she'd probably been killed about ten minutes before I got there.

turns.speaker: JORGENSEN
turns.text: I thought you said you weren't going there.

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: Why, you said...

turns.speaker: JORGENSEN
turns.text: Never mind.

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: We're just having a little drink.

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: So I see.

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: Who's that man?

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: He's not anybody.  Just a fellow I used to know.

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: I thought you'd given up that sort of friend.

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: This is the first time I've seen him in years.  I didn't want him to think I was high-hatting him.

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: I don't like him.

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: Don't worry.  You won't see him again.  What happened? Did you change your mind about going?

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: No.  I just came back for a second. I wanted to get those bonds.

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: What bonds?

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: The government bonds.  The ones you took from the office safe.

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: Oh yes.  Why, you told me to sell them a long time ago.

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: I'd never tell you to sell those. I bought them for my daughter.

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: Don't you remember....

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: Now see here, Julia.  You're counting a little too much on my being absent-minded.  You've been taking a little here and there for some time, and I haven't said anything about it.  But this is fifty thousand dollars!

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: Do you realize that you're accusing me of ....

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: No one else had the combination of that safe.  You took them.  What did you do with them?

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: What if I did take them? I'm sick and tired of seeing you hand out thousands of dollars to that family of yours....

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: That's my business.

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: supporting that gang of loafers! There's not one of them that cares a damn for you.  A wife who threw you out the first time your foot slipped.  They wouldn't raise a hand to help you.  And I've given my whole life for you.  If you kicked off tomorrow, where'd I be? Out in the gutter!  Sure I took those bonds.  Who has a better right -- ?

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: I want that money right now, or I'll hand you over to the police.

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: Go ahead!

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: They'll be pretty rough with you....with your record.

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: That's a fine thing to throw up to me after all I've been to you....

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: Hello ....  give me ....  Well ....  ?

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: I'll give it back to you ....  all I've got ....twenty-five thousand...

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: You're going to return every cent of it!

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: I can't! I haven't got it!

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: What did you do with the rest?

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: I never had it.

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: Then someone was in with you.  Who was it? -- Who was it?  I'll answer that --  Hello ...  hello ...

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Is there a Mr. Macaulay in the house?  Oh, it's you.

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Oh, hello.  Come on in.

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: Good morning. I'm afraid this isn't a very "Merry Christmas" for you.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Oh, he's sitting up.

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Asta - don't bother Mr. Macaulay.

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: That's all right.

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: I got word from Wynant this morning...

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: So did we.  I mean, Sherlock here.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Oh, please, Nick.

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: Would it help any if I could persuade him to meet you?

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: Did you get my money?

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: I do wish you'd tell me where you're going.

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: I'm not telling anyone.

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: But suppose some business comes up...

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: That's just why I'm going.

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: One hundred...  two hundred... three...

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: Never mind.

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: I wish you'd count them.  There's a thousand dollars there.

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: I trust you.

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: Isn't there anything else I can do for you? Have you bought your ticket?

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: Well, let me do that for you.

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: You might do that.  Get me a ticket for...  No, you don't!

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: Thanks, and goodbye.

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: What'll I do if something comes up?

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: Settle it yourself.  What have I got a lawyer for?

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: Is Julia going with you?

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: But what if you need more money?

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: I left instructions with Julia. She'll get it from you.  Goodbye.

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: How are you?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Hello, Macaulay.  Come in.

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: Dorothy told me you were here.  I was going to telephone but....

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: That's all right.  What are you drinking?

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: Nothing, thank you.  Nothing.  I wanted to see you...  What's Mimi up to, Charles?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Mimi?  ...  Oh, Dorothy's mother.  Does she have to be up to something?

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: She usually is.  Trying one way or another to get money out of Wynant. I wanted to find out if you were er - er -  --sleuthing for her.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I haven't been a detective for four years.

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: You don't say --

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: My wife's father died and left her a lumber mill and a narrow guage railroad and a couple of other things.  And I'm looking after them.

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: I see.  I see.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: What's all the fuss about? Is he in hiding?

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: You know as much about it as I do. I haven't seen him in three months.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: No word at all?

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: He sends word through Julia Wolf when he wants money...  I give it to her and she gives it to him.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: My wife.

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: How do you do?  What did you say?....  He is?.... Where is he?  Very well.  He's back in town....  Wynant.  Thank heaven.  He's waiting for me now.  Forgive me, Mrs. Charles...  but I've been so upset.  It's no joke working for a man like that.  I must be off.  Goodbye....  Goodbye,

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: S'long.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: How are you?

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: I hate to bother you when you're laid up.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: That's all right.

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: What are the chances of getting you to do what he wants?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Slim.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: It might.

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: He gave me a code message to insert in the Times, in case I wanted to get in touch with him.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: It wouldn't hurt to put it in.

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: I've done that already. He should appear, you know.  It doesn't look well... his staying away at a time like this.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Hello.... oh, just a minute.  Police department?

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: Hello....  Where?  In Allentown.  Yes... When is the next train? Right - I'll get that.  Wynant's tried to commit suicide. They want me to come down and identify him.  I guess this changes the whole story, doesn't it?  That looks like an admission of guilt.  And I had such hopes.  I thought if you got on the case, you'd be able to clear him.  I thought that Mimi.... the way she acted... I was sure that....  Oh, well, well... it's no use thinking of it now.  I'm sorry to have wasted so much of your time.

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: But it must have been Wynant.  I should have known if it weren't his voice.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Oh he as clever about that.  He called when you were out.  That same afternoon, Julia telephoned to him. She said that you were coming, Mimi, to ask about Wynant. He got terrified. He was afraid that Julia would break down and tell... so he went to Julia and killed her and left Wynant's watch chain in her hand.

turns.speaker: MACAULAY
turns.text: I have no right to answer that.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: What about it, Tanner.  Isn't that the truth?

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: Oh, Nick... Nick!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Hello, Mimi.

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: want to talk to you about something very important.
